pages.text: The Engineer's Crafting Table is a simple upgrade to the normal Crafting Table. In addition to the polished, treated wood surface, it keeps the ingredient inside the crafting grid when the interface is closed. It also features a small drawer to store some of your crafting components.

The Engineer's Workbench is a professional worktable for the educated engineer. It is widely used to construct the items described in $(l:patchouli:essentials/engineers_blueprints)Engineer's Blueprints$().
A wide variety of blueprints can be crafted, whereas a few select ones can only be discovered in the world or purchased from villagers.
As you will find yourself creating engineering components more frequently, it may be advisable to draft a Blueprint for them.

To use a blueprint in the Workbench, put it in the slot on the left of the GUI and the necessary ingredients in the six slots in the middle. The resulting items can then be retrieved from the right side. Hovering your mouse over these output slots will inform you exactly which materials are needed for each item.

Additionally, a secondary function of the Workbench is the modification and configuration of more complex tools and gadgets. The $(l:tools/mining_drill)Mining Drill$(), $(l:tools/heavy_plated_shield)Heavy Plated Shield$() or $(l:tools/revolver)Revolver$() are examples of such items. $(br)When placed in the main slot of the workbench, it's use becomes that of modifying these tools by inserting applicable upgrades into the new slots that appear.
